title: Argentina’s populist candidate Javier Milei holds economic talk with IMF
description: Milei assured the International Monetary Fund that Argentina would not default on its debts if he is elected, aide says.

title: California receives first tropical storm watch as Hurricane Hilary nears
description: The Category 4 hurricane is anticipated to make landfall in the Mexican state of Baja California before moving north.

title: Israeli police arrest and brand Palestinian with ‘Star of David’: Report
description: A Palestinian man who was detained from Shuafat refugee camp in occupied East Jerusalem says he was brutally abused.

title: ECOWAS defence chiefs agree ‘D-day’ for Niger military intervention
description: West African bloc agrees to activate standby force as a last resort if diplomatic efforts fail after coup in Niger.

title: Leaders of US, South Korea and Japan hail summit as ‘turning point’
description: Countries pledge to deepen partnership at historic Camp David talks, while condemning China and North Korea.

title: Woman arrested after spraying Quran-burner with fire extinguisher in Sweden
description: Quran-burnings have sparked angry protests in Muslim countries, attacks on Swedish diplomatic missions and threats.

title: What’s behind Javier Milei’s election win in Argentina?
description: Victory by far-right candidate in Argentina's presidential primary causes global shockwaves.

title: China pledges to ‘safeguard sovereignty’ after Taiwanese leader visits US
description: Lai is the front-runner to be Taiwan's next president at elections set for January.

title: Pitch to progress: Lessons from Morocco’s Women’s World Cup success
description: By investing in women's football, Morocco also invested in gender equality.

title: Photos: Meet the research team working to save Gaza’s history, heritage
description: The Eyes on Heritage institute aims to digitally archive thousands of rare books and manuscripts that date back hundreds

title: Iran’s top diplomat extends Saudi trip, meets Crown Prince MBS
description: Foreign Minister Hossein Amir-Abdollahian held meetings with his Saudi counterpart on Thursday.

title: Biden administration extends protected status for Ukrainians in US
description: Washington shields Ukrainians from deportation for another 18 months in extension of Temporary Protected Status.

title: Nurse found guilty of murdering seven newborn babies in UK
description: Lucy Letby injected her sick and pre-mature young victims with air, overfeeding with milk and poisoning with insulin.

title: Trump’s Republican rivals to speak in Atlanta, days after indictment
description: Conservative conference comes after Georgia prosecutors charged former US president over election interference.

title: Attacks on aid workers in Sudan must stop now
description: At least 19 aid workers have died since the conflict started in mid-April. Targeting them is illegal and inhuman.

title: Two Christians arrested in Pakistan over blasphemy accusation
description: The alleged desecration of pages of the Quran led a violent mob to attack Christian homes and churches this week.

title: Residents flee blazes in Western Canada as record fire season continues
description: Evacuations ordered in the Northwest Territories and British Columbia as country reels from worst fire season on record.

title: Russia shuts down human rights group Sakharov Center
description: Moscow City Court said it was dissolving the organisation for illegally hosting conferences and exhibitions.

title: The Sudanese who fled war for weeks, now praying for a boat to Europe
description: Al Jazeera speaks to Sudanese refugees in Tunisia's Sfax who dream of 'complete security' across the Mediterranean.

title: Yellowknife residents leave by air, road as fire evacuation deadline looms
description: More than 20 evacuation flights out of Canada's Northwest Territories are expected on Friday as wildfires rage.

title: Will Ecuador voters set a precedent on oil drilling in the Amazon?
description: Citizens are set to vote in a historic referendum on whether oil extraction should continue in Yasuni National Park.

title: ECOWAS defence chiefs continue talks on possible Niger intervention
description: ECOWAS defence chiefs are attending a two-day meeting in Accra to discuss a possible military operation in Niger.

title: The former Afghan soldiers turning to gem mining to survive
description: In remote Nuristan province, some mine to support their families after losing their jobs when the Taliban took power.

title: UN suspends services at Palestinian refugee camp in Lebanon after clashes
description: UN refugee agency has called on armed actors within the refugee camp to immediately vacate its facilities.

title: Netherlands says US has approved delivery of F-16s to Ukraine
description: Washington says the F-16s, like the US Abrams tanks, will be crucial in countering Russia.

title: Former Austrian leader charged with giving false evidence to an inquiry
description: Charges result from an investigation that was launched in 2021 when Kurz was still chancellor.

title: Pakistan’s blasphemy law: All you need to know
description: Alleged blasphemers risk death at the hands of vigilantes, even under unproven allegations of insulting Islam.

title: Niger becomes hotbed of disinformation after July 26 coup
description: Social media has been inundated with false rumours, misleading videos and manipulated audio clips since Niger's coup.

title: Drug war shakes France’s Marseille as rival gangs shoot it out
description: Clashes between Yoda and DZ Mafia gangs have killed dozens of people this year, according to police.

title: Maui emergency chief resigns after criticism over Hawaii wildfire response
description: Herman Andaya, head of Maui Emergency Management Agency, had defended his decision not to sound warning sirens.

title: I’m a striking Hollywood writer, and I won’t settle for scraps any more
description: The studios don't realise: The strike has radicalised all Hollywood writers. We'll only agree to real change.

title: Magnitude 6.3 earthquake shakes Colombian capital
description: One woman died after jumping from the 10th floor of a building amid panic in Bogota.

title: Woman who posted ricin poison to Trump in 2020 jailed for almost 22 years
description: Pascale Ferrier, 56, pleaded guilty to biological weapons charges for sending ricin in 2020 to then-US President Trump.

title: ‘Called to do this’: Nelson Chamisa promises new dawn for troubled Zimbabwe
description: The 45-year-old is contesting the presidency for the second time in five years against incumbent President Mnangagwa.

title: Are these really the world’s happiest countries?
description: And why are so many of them often rich, Western nations?

title: Xi Jinping to make state visit to South Africa, attend BRICS summit
description: Trip will be Xi's second overseas visit of 2023 and comes as China attempts to expand its geopolitical influence.

title: Debt-ridden China developer Evergrande files for bankruptcy in US
description: Move will protect property giant's assets in the United States as it attempts to restructure.

title: US authorities investigate threats to grand jury after Trump indictment
description: Threats reported after personal data of 23 jurors and three alternates, including images and addresses, posted online.

title: Ukraine drone attack damages building in central Moscow: Russian officials
description: Moscow's mayor says Ukrainian drone shot down by air defence and debris falls on city's Expo Center causing some damage.

title: Putin not pushing Belarus to join Ukraine war, Lukashenko says
description: Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko says Russian leader has achieved 'goals' in Ukraine and now time to negotiate.

title: UN says N Korea expanding military programmes while people suffer
description: First discussion of isolated country's human rights in six years draws anger from Russia and China.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 541
description: As the war enters its 541st day, these are the main developments.
